DOC.brief_summary: Reinforcement interventions have pronounced effects on reducing cocaine use. This study will evaluate a novel approach in which reinforcement frequency varies by patient performance. To test efficacy, 280 patients with cocaine use disorder will be randomly assigned to: standard care, standard care plus traditional twice weekly reinforcement, or standard care plus adaptive variable interval reinforcement.
DOC.brief_title: Extending Long-term Outcomes Through an Adaptive Aftercare Intervention
DOC.criteria: be age 18 years or older have a cocaine use disorder diagnosis be willing to sign informed consent and able to pass an informed consent quiz serious, uncontrolled psychiatric illness in recovery from pathological gambling do not speak English
